_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Good Morning Skiers and Riders! This is Laurie with your 5 am snow report for Tuesday, December 2nd. Remember, the easiest way to get up to date information is on the Ikon Pass app or website.  
At Mid Mountain, weve had 1 new inch of snow in the past 24 hours, with 0 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  
At the Summit, weve had 1 new inch of snow in the past 24 hours, with 0 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  
Our Mid mountain base is 9 inches, the temperature is 16 degrees, the winds are 5 miles per hour from the West, and it's currently snowing. 
The Summit base is 13 inches, the temperature is 9 degrees, the winds are 18 miles per hour from the West and its snowing. 
The base temperature is 15 degrees.  
We will be skiing and riding on 5 lifts, 5 runs, and 72.5 acres on PP/MM snow.  
Stop by The Range Food & Drink Hall this afternoon for some live music starting at 3:30. Grab a drink, get a snack, and enjoy a solo performer downstairs or a DJ on the upstairs deck.  
Stay in the know with the Ikon Pass App. Find it in the app store on your mobile device and get lift and trail statuses, conditions updates, and more.  
If you are thinking of exploring outside the ski area boundaries, and dont know exactly where you are going, dont go.  
Ski and Ride with Care and we will see you on the mountain!
